author: Staff Reporter
text:
Eight persons were injured in a cylinder blast in a house at Ellayur village in Denkanikottai on Tuesday.

The blast at the house of Mehboob Jaan, a daily wage labourer in Mallachandram Panchayat.

According to sources, the incident occurred when Taj Unnisha, wife of Mehboob Jaan, attempted to fix the regulator from an empty cylinder onto a full cylinder, when she had sensed a gas leak.

The woman requested her neighbour Ramesh to help her out. When Ramesh fixed the regulator and switched on the gas stove, the cylinder exploded.

The explosion ripped apart the thatched roof. Among the injured were an 80-year-old woman, and four children, including a 17-year-old girl. Taj Unnisha suffered severe burns and was admitted to the Dharmapuri Government Medical College Hospital, while the others were undergoing treatment at the Denkanikottai Government Hospital.
title: Eight injured in LPG cylinder blast
